SW.content: sericulture, culture of silk: the incomparable patience it demands from sericultivator
SW.linkedContent: sericulture, culture of silk: the incomparable patience it demands from sericultivator

SW.content: for Freud, women discovered one technique, weaving (veiling), but really they just copied nature (pubic hair) > unveiled the means of veiling
SW.linkedContent: for Freud, women discovered one technique, weaving (veiling), but really they just copied nature (pubic hair) > unveiled the means of veiling

SW.content: if tekhnē never broke radically w/ physis—why reserve this animal naturality to woman? > woman weaves like a body secreting its own textile, like a worm, a worm w/out worm, a worm concerned to hide her non-being
SW.linkedContent: if tekhnē never broke radically w/ physis—why reserve this animal naturality to woman? > woman weaves like a body secreting its own textile, like a worm, a worm w/out worm, a worm concerned to hide her non-being

SW.content: tallith as intimate secretion, opened, given birth by divine word preceding it, & also separate, dissociated, dissolves bond, holds to secret
SW.linkedContent: tallith as intimate secretion, opened, given birth by divine word preceding it, & also separate, dissociated, dissolves bond, holds to secret

SW.content: silkworm’s sex impossible to discern, the spitting outside oneself, secretion, of what will never leave it: female ejaculate, milk become thread, fantasy of penis (neither veil, nor web)
SW.linkedContent: silkworm’s sex impossible to discern, the spitting outside oneself, secretion, of what will never leave it: female ejaculate, milk become thread, fantasy of penis (neither veil, nor web)

SW.content: “fainting to the bottom of oneself” > “burying oneself gloriously in the shadow at the bottom of the other” > “its work and its being toward death”
SW.linkedContent: “fainting to the bottom of oneself” > “burying oneself gloriously in the shadow at the bottom of the other” > “its work and its being toward death”

SW.content: Celan: “Aschenglorie (…) grub ich mich in dich und in dich” > [I in you—love itself] love made itself make love next to watching dreaming child [too old, forbidden to be old, still young]
SW.linkedContent: Celan: “Aschenglorie (…) grub ich mich in dich und in dich” > [I in you—love itself] love made itself make love next to watching dreaming child [too old, forbidden to be old, still young]

SW.content: absolute knowledge not man’s thing but that of sericulture [?] > silkworm comes back to itself in its odyssey, wraps itself in its own shroud, kind of absolute knowledge: beyond any coupling, any sexual difference or rather duality of the sexes > [Derrida’s bestiary starting up]
SW.linkedContent: absolute knowledge not man’s thing but that of sericulture [?] > silkworm comes back to itself in its odyssey, wraps itself in its own shroud, kind of absolute knowledge: beyond any coupling, any sexual difference or rather duality of the sexes > [Derrida’s bestiary starting up]

SW.content: philosophy of nature, for the child I still am, was naivety itself, but also time of infinite apprenticeship, culture made up acc. fiction, the autobiography of lure (Dichtung und Wahrheit), beginning to write a novel of sericulture
SW.linkedContent: philosophy of nature, for the child I still am, was naivety itself, but also time of infinite apprenticeship, culture made up acc. fiction, the autobiography of lure (Dichtung und Wahrheit), beginning to write a novel of sericulture

SW.content: Derrida’s call, grain of a telephone ring: véraison (vary, change color, moment of ripening)—the moment the unforeseeable reappropriation of the silkworm took place > the surprise I had to expect never makes a mistake, took place only once, demands all time given to become what it was: the verdict, what a note, what news > as if nothing evil ever happened again, or only happen w/ death: “too late” > Derrida will never tell this tale, he promised
SW.linkedContent: Derrida’s call, grain of a telephone ring: véraison (vary, change color, moment of ripening)—the moment the unforeseeable reappropriation of the silkworm took place > the surprise I had to expect never makes a mistake, took place only once, demands all time given to become what it was: the verdict, what a note, what news > as if nothing evil ever happened again, or only happen w/ death: “too late” > Derrida will never tell this tale, he promised
